snippet: The N.B.A. announced the sale of the New Orleans Hornets to the owner of the Saints for $338 million. But the league faced the real possibility that the Sacramento Kings would move.
abstract: NBA resolves one franchise headache when it announces the sale of the New Orleans Hornets, a ward of the league since 2010, to Tom Benson, the owner of NFL's New Orleans Saints, for $338 million; league also faces the collapse of a tentative deal to build an arena for the Sacramento Kings, and the very real possibility that the franchise will move, as has been threatened before.
lead_paragraph: The N.B.A. announced the sale of the New Orleans Hornets to the owner of the Saints for $338 million. But the league faced the real possibility that the Sacramento Kings would move.

headline.seo: New Orleans Hornets Are Sold, but Sacramento Kings May Move
headline.main: N.B.A. Solidifies One Ownership Issue, but Another Takes a Wrong Turn
headline.print_headline: N.B.A. Solidifies One Ownership Issue, but Another Takes a Wrong Turn
